aquarium

Class Aquarium

  • java.lang.Object
    • aquarium.Aquarium

  • public class Aquarium
extends java.lang.Object
    The Aquarium holds the animation logic for creatures which may be added using fillWithCreatures. It is normally created and started from AquariumMain.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEIGHT
      The height of the Aquarium's water area in pixels.

      The height of the Aquarium's sky area in pixels.

      The width of the Aquarium in pixels.

      • updateCreatureLocations

        public void updateCreatureLocations()

        Calls the Creature.updateLocation() method for each Creature in the Aquarium, and then calls event methods in order.

        1. Creature.hitClouds() if the Creature has touched or gone past the top of the sky.
        2. Creature.hitSurface() if the Creature is touching the surface of the water;
        3. Creature.hitFloor() if the bottom edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the Aquarium floor;
        4. Creature.hitLeftWall() if the left edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the left wall;
        5. Creature.hitRightWall() if the right edge of the Creature has touched or gone past the right wall;

        These methods are called only once for a given movement. For example, if a creature approaches and touches the left wall, then stays on or past the wall, Creature.hitLeftWall() will be called only once. If the creature reapproaches the wall and moves past it in the other direction, Creature.hitLeftWall() will be called again.

        A Creature can cause more than one event to be triggered simultaneously; for example, if a Creature moves from below the floor to above the clouds, Creature.hitClouds(), Creature.hitSurface(), and Creature.hitFloor() will all be called.

        If multiple events occur at once, they will be called in the order they are listed above.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Aquarium animation.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the Aquarium animation.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
